content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Accessibility Tree with numerical label representing information about the page, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
4) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {Accessibility Tree of a web page}

Now given a task: List the benefits of hugging face classroom mentioned on Hugging face website.  Please interact with https://huggingface.co/ and get the answer.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Search for "classroom" on Hugging Face
Action: Type [44]; classroom
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: We need broader web search to find ‚ÄúHugging Face Classroom‚Äù benefits, easier via Google  
Action: Google
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to search Google for ‚ÄúHugging Face Classroom benefits‚Äù  
Action: Type [1]; Hugging Face Classroom benefits
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Google blocked; return to Hugging Face site and look for ‚ÄúClassrooms‚Äù page via its own navigation  
Action: GoBack
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Navigate directly to huggingface.co by typing the URL in Google‚Äôs search/omnibox field  
Action: Type [1]; huggingface.co
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Return to Google home page, then directly navigate to https://huggingface.co  
Action: GoBack
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Go back further in history to return to the Hugging Face website page we were on earlier  
Action: GoBack
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Navigate to Hugging Face homepage, where we can look for ‚ÄúClassrooms‚Äù section  
Action: Click [2078]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Use the Hugging Face search bar to search for ‚ÄúClassroom‚Äù
Action: Type [3121]; Classroom
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Use Google to directly find the Hugging Face ‚ÄúClassroom‚Äù page that lists its benefits
Action: Google
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Perform Google search for ‚ÄúHugging Face Classroom‚Äù
Action: Type [1]; Hugging Face Classroom
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Google is blocked; need to return to Hugging Face website to locate a ‚Äú/classroom‚Äù page manually
Action: GoBack
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Open the likely URL for the Classroom product page directly on Hugging Face  
Action: Type [1]; https://huggingface.co/classrooms
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Return further to the Hugging Face site (before switching to Google) so I can search within the site for the ‚ÄúClassrooms‚Äù page  
Action: GoBack
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Navigate directly to the Hugging Face Classrooms page by entering its URL in the omnibox/search field  
Action: Type [1]; https://huggingface.co/classrooms
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Return to previous page before Google redirect to reach Hugging Face site or earlier Hugging Face page.  
Action: GoBack
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Continue going back in browser history to return to the last Hugging Face page (before navigating to Google).  
Action: GoBack
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Use Hugging Face search box to search ‚ÄúClassrooms‚Äù and find the relevant product page that lists its benefits  
Action: Type [4943]; Classrooms
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Return to Hugging Face homepage to search site navigation for a ‚ÄúClassrooms‚Äù (education) product page listing its benefits.  
Action: Click [6595]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Navigate directly to the likely product page /classrooms on Hugging Face to look for its benefits  
Action: Type [9775]; https://huggingface.co/classrooms
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Replace the current search query with the keyword ‚Äúclassroom‚Äù to find relevant Hugging Face pages about classrooms or a Classroom product page.  
Action: Type [11510]; classroom
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Try opening a Hugging Face blog post that may describe the ‚ÄúClassrooms‚Äù feature and list its benefits  
Action: Type [11506]; https://huggingface.co/blog/classrooms
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Return to Hugging Face home, so I can look at the top-level navigation and search for a ‚ÄúClassrooms‚Äù (education) link instead of using the full-text search results.  
Action: Click [11608]

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Go to Hugging Face homepage via the logo link to access site navigation and look for a ‚ÄúClassrooms‚Äù page.  
Action: Click [16186]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Scroll to page bottom to see footer navigation links‚Äîthere may be an ‚ÄúEducation‚Äù or ‚ÄúClassrooms‚Äù link that leads to a page listing Classroom benefits.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to reach the footer to look for a link such as ‚ÄúClassrooms‚Äù or ‚ÄúEducation‚Äù. Continue scrolling downward.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to reach the footer where navigation links (possibly ‚ÄúClassrooms‚Äù or ‚ÄúEducation‚Äù) are usually located. Continue scrolling downward.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down

Observation: please analyze the accessibility tree and give the Thought and Action.
